tables.description: This contains definitions about our KPIs.  Each entry defines a KPI set which consists of between 1 and 10 integer measures and 1 and 6 floating point measures.  There are also 6 dimensions. It gives us names for all of these items as well as a unique identifier for the KPI set and details such as name, owner, group and description.

schema.name: KPI_ID
schema.description: The unique identifier for the KPI

schema.name: KPI_NAME
schema.description: KPI Name

schema.name: KPI_GROUP_ID
schema.description: The identifier for KPI group, (first character from KPI_ID)

schema.name: KPI_GROUP_NAME
schema.description: KPI Group Name

schema.name: KPI_OWNER
schema.description: The Business Owner of the KPI

schema.name: KPI_DESCRIPTION
schema.description: Brief Description of the KPI

schema.name: KPI_LEVEL
schema.description: KPI level

schema.name: DIM1_NAME
schema.description: The string value of the first dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM2_NAME
schema.description: The string value of the second dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM3_NAME
schema.description: The string value of the third dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM4_NAME
schema.description: The string value of the fourth dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM5_NAME
schema.description: The string value of the fifth dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM6_NAME
schema.description: The string value of the sixth dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: INT01_NAME
schema.description: The first string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT01_AGG
schema.description: The aggregation applied on the the first string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT02_NAME
schema.description: The second string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT02_AGG
schema.description: The aggregation applied on the second string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT03_NAME
schema.description: The third string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT03_AGG
schema.description: The aggregation applied on the third string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT04_NAME
schema.description: The fourth string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT04_AGG
schema.description: The aggregation applied on the fourth string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT05_NAME
schema.description: The fifth string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT05_AGG
schema.description: The fifth aggregation applied on the fifth string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT06_NAME
schema.description: The sixth string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT06_AGG
schema.description: The sixth aggregation applied on the sixth string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT07_NAME
schema.description: The seventh string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT07_AGG
schema.description: The seventh aggregation applied on the seventh  string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT08_NAME
schema.description: The eighth string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT08_AGG
schema.description: The eighth aggregation applied on the eighth string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT09_NAME
schema.description: The ninth string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT09_AGG
schema.description: The ninth aggregation applied on the ninth string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: INT10_NAME
schema.description: The tenth string name of an integer result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: INT10_AGG
schema.description: The tenth aggregation applied on the tenth string name of an integer result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT1_NAME
schema.description: The first string name of a float result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: FLOAT1_AGG
schema.description: The first aggregation applied on the first string name of a float result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT2_NAME
schema.description: The second string name of a float result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: FLOAT2_AGG
schema.description: The second aggregation applied on the second string name of a float result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT3_NAME
schema.description: The third string name of a float result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: FLOAT3_AGG
schema.description: The third aggregation applied on the third string name of a float result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT4_NAME
schema.description: The fourth string name of a float result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: FLOAT4_AGG
schema.description: The fourth aggregation applied on the fourth string name of a float result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT5_NAME
schema.description: The fifth string name of a float result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: FLOAT5_AGG
schema.description: The fifth aggregation applied on the fifth string name of a float result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT6_NAME
schema.description: The sixth string name of a float result of our KPI which can be aggregated across the various dimensions as needed

schema.name: FLOAT6_AGG
schema.description: The sixth aggregation applied on the sixth string name of a float result of our KPI

tables.description: This table contains the actual KPI details for all our KPI sets that have been implemented here so far.  Each row in the table is one of a number of entries for that KPI set.

schema.name: KPI_DATE
schema.description: The calendar date to which this set of KPI data applies.

schema.name: KPI_WEEK
schema.description: The Sky / Comcast week that the KPI date above falls into.

schema.name: KPI_ID
schema.description: The unique identifier for the KPI allowing us to link to its definition data.

schema.name: KPI_GROUP_ID
schema.description: The identifier of the KPI group that the KPI is a part of.

schema.name: COUNTRY
schema.description: The Sky country or territory that the KPI data applies to.

schema.name: OPERATOR
schema.description: The division or operator within Sky that the KPI applies to, e.g. Sky or Now.

schema.name: DIM1
schema.description: The string value of the first dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM2
schema.description: The string value of the second dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM3
schema.description: The string value of the third dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM4
schema.description: The string value of the fourth dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM5
schema.description: The string value of the fifth dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: DIM6
schema.description: The string value of the sixth dimension by which we can analyse the KPI data.

schema.name: INT01
schema.description: The first integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT02
schema.description: The second integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT03
schema.description: The third integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT04
schema.description: The fourth integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT05
schema.description: The fifth integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT06
schema.description: The sixth integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT07
schema.description: The seventh integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT08
schema.description: The eighth integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT09
schema.description: The ninth integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: INT10
schema.description: The tenth integer resultof our KPI which can be summed across the various dimensions as needed.

schema.name: FLOAT01
schema.description: The first floating point result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT02
schema.description: The second floating point result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT03
schema.description: The third floating point result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT04
schema.description: The fourth floating point result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT05
schema.description: The fifth floating point result of our KPI

schema.name: FLOAT06
schema.description: The sixth floating point result of our KPI
